etymology.description: 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") + 八(八) (bā, "eight") provides sound = redundant or spare
etymology.interpretation: The character 冗(rǒng) combines 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") as the semantic component with 八(八) (bā, "eight") serving as a phonetic component, suggesting something extra or redundant, as if covered overly so.

examples.chinese: 这篇文章太冗(這篇文章太冗)。
他的演讲冗长(他的演講冗長)，听众感到疲倦(聽眾感到疲倦)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yǎnjiǎng rǒngcháng, tīngzhòng gǎndào píkùn.
examples.english: His speech was long-winded, making the audience feel tired.

examples.chinese: 报告中不必要的部分显得冗(報告中不必要的部分顯得冗)，应予删除(應予刪除)。
examples.pinyin: Bàogào zhōng bù bìyào de bùfèn xiǎndé rǒng, yīng yǔ shānchú.
examples.english: The unnecessary parts of the report appear redundant and should be removed.
